Package com.receiver2d.engine

General classes of the Receiver2D game engine exist here.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Console
    This class is used for logging and debugging information.
    Console.Message
    A Console message object, containing various types of information that may be useful for storing in the backlog.
    Physics
    The basic portion of the engine that deals with physics calculations for all entities that have a Rigidbody component attached.
    Receiver2D
    This is the main class, where the engine can be started and managed.
    Scene
    A Scene object contains a graph of all entities, specific constants, and the Skybox that comprise the current segment of the game's progress.
    ThreadManager
    Is responsible for threading all of the game's processes.
    Transform2D
    This class deals with all entities/objects that are translatable in two-dimensional space.
    Vector2D
    Contains point data (x, y).
    World
    Holds all of the game information for a particular world, including scenes, entities, and more low-level stuff such as resources (loaded dynamically when transitioning to new worlds).
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Console.DebugMode
    Modes of debugging, different from levels above
    Console.LogLevel
    Involves specificity for messages, allowing them to be grouped accordingly, in addition to introducing special behavior for the Console.

Package com.receiver2d.engine Description

General classes of the Receiver2D game engine exist here.
